TypeDescription: This is typically the most affordable option and provides basic amenities such as a bed, dresser, and TV.
Suites usually offer more space and amenities than standard rooms, such as a separate living area, kitchenette, and multiple bathrooms.
Deluxe rooms offer additional features such as a balcony or sea view, upgraded bedding, and improved d√©cor.
Executive rooms are designed for business travelers and offer perks such as free breakfast, evening drink, and high-speed internet.
A room specifically designed to accommodate families, often with multiple beds and additional space for children.
Two or more rooms with a connecting door, providing flexibility for larger groups or families traveling together.
An extravagant, top-floor suite with exceptional views and exclusive amenities, typically chosen for special occasions or VIP guests.
A standalone cottage-style accommodation, providing privacy and a sense of seclusion often within a resort setting
